author: Erylion
title: Too cute for their own good.
review:
My wife threw this little box of cuteness into our shopping cart today on a whim.  I certainly won't complain.

Box/Instructions

Nothing notable.

Parts

A few nice inclusions:

- feeding bottle

- basket

- dark tan 1x2 bricks

- carrot!

Minifigures

Though there aren't any actual minifigs, the rabbits are without a doubt adorable.  The two smaller bunnies seem more suited to regular minifgure scale, so they should work better than the larger one in a forest scene for MOCs.  Strangely, the small ones still have the little hole on their heads to accommodate a bow, but the bow is almost as big as they are, so it looks ridiculous.  I wonder if there are other accessories that might work better, though I prefer them unadorned anyway.

The build

Rudimentary.

The completed model

Bright and cheery, but unremarkable.

Overall opinion

The build isn't anything special, but the bunnies make it worth the buy (the smaller ones in particular).  I rejoice whenever my wife opts to buy LEGO of her own volition, so I consider it money well-spent.

author: BrickTin
title: Tiny cute set
review:
Little set with rare pieces.

Box/Instructions

The box is very small but representative. The intructions are quite small, just one sheet of paper.

Parts

This set comes with some great useful parts as well some exclusive ones - baby bunies.

The baby bunies can be used as minifigure sized animals. A carrot is a rarer piece and also two mason bricks.

Minifigures

This set has't got any minidolls/minifigures.

The build

Building of this set is simple but still very enjoyable.

The completed model

The model doesn't really look so good on the shelf. The set has a better value for the pieces.

Overall opinion

This set is a must for bunny lovers and Friends sets buyers. Comes with some rare pieces and threee animals (rabbits).
